metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3752 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Content Security Policy implementation in WebKit in Apple Safari before6.2.8, 7.x before 7.1.8, and 8.x before 8.0.8, as used in iOS before 8.4.1and other products, does not properly restrict cookie transmission forreport requests, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitiveinformation via vectors involving (1) a cross-origin request or (2) aprivate-browsing request.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3752` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-1.0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-3.0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
gir1.2-webkit-1.0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
gir1.2-webkit-3.0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-3.0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-bin - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-3.0-25 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwebkitgtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwebkitgtk-1.0-common - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwebkitgtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwebkitgtk-3.0-common - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
